data.title: Long Time Gone: The Autobiography of David Crosby: Carl Gottlieb, Crosby, David: 9780385245302: Amazon.com: Books
data.meta_description: Long Time Gone: The Autobiography of David Crosby [Carl Gottlieb, Crosby, David] on Amazon.com. *FREE* shipping on qualifying offers. Long Time Gone: The Autobiography of David Crosby
data.text:
Customers find the book an excellent, detailed read that's highly entertaining and engrossing. They also say it's a wonderful account of success, mistakes, and divine intervention.

"...I certainly didn't. This is a good read, but detailed stories about his (first person) drug use is eye-opening, and depressing at the same time...." Read more

"...of sailing, and all those who experiences around that were great fun to learn about, and but one example of the pleasures and privilege that his..." Read more

"...This is a good book. Maybe one of the late-twentieth century's most tellable tales. Maybe, like the story of Job, a tale for the ages." Read more

Customers find the story honest, insightful, and well-written. They also say the book is done with passion and realism.

"...Anyway, the book was great. He has a lot of wonderful stories, any one of which would make for a good book..." Read more

"...Holy cow -- this is a highly entertaining, engrossing story of the American Dream gone good, gone bad, then gone good again...." Read more

"What a remarkable journey told with such truth.I am amazed he is alive and I have such admiration for graham Nash what a true friend." Read more

Customers find the book readable, engaging, and inspiring. They also mention that the book is written in several voices, including David's.

"This is THE MOST informative & well written biography I have ever encountered...." Read more

"...It is written in several voices, including David's, so you get differing points of view regarding his amazing life. I recommend it...." Read more

"...But, I also love the way the book is written. You get David's view and in context you hear the view of others around him at the point in time...." Read more

"...I really appreciated the style the authors pursued combining several of David's friends and detractors...." Read more

Customers find the book extremely insightful and interesting. They also mention that it has an interesting biographical approach.

"...This is clearly THE MOST OUTSTANDING research I have ever read about Genius, Drug Addiction, Love, Rebellion, Money, Fame, & everything that life..." Read more

"Great info and insight of the sixties west coast rock scene. A bit of a downer about the long destructive hard drug road...." Read more

"...Still, it was extremely insightful on his and Jan's addiction. Dang, they went through hell and back. Kudos on their sobriety." Read more

"...The book doesn't just cover Crosby's career, but gives the reader insight into the people and events surrounding him. Great read!" Read more

Customers find the author amazing and mention the book is an amazing document about an amazing performer.

"...He was marvelous! I wished I had read his book before the concert, because I had no idea all the troubles he'd had throughout his career...." Read more

"This book was really good about David Crosby and Crosby,,Stills and Nash .Graham Nash was a generous friend to Crosby" Read more

"This book is an amazing document about an amazing performer, born at the right time, in the right place, with the right set of talents needed to..." Read more

"...on music on an international scale... He is by far one of the most talented musicians...." Read more

Customers find the music profound and beautiful. They also appreciate the candid look at an American music icon and the sweet love story.

"...It Biblical. It's also an extraordinary, and sweet in its way, love story...." Read more

"...Their music was melodic and the message of life, hope and despair was present in their lyrics...." Read more

"...all, he could still sing and write some of the most profound and beautiful music of that generation. Still loved after all these years." Read more

"...If you love their music, you will love this great, candid look at an American music icon!" Read more

Customers find the page layout of the book ugly, boring, and awful. They also say there's no glamour and unpleasant characters.

"...No glamour here and, quite simply, an unpleasant character who strives to make directness about his awfulness to others a virtue...." Read more

"...If I had known that most of this book is actually boring sidebars from the co-author and Crosby's story as told by his friends, with the occasional..." Read more

"...sailor I liked the sailing parts best, but for the drugs what an ugly way to live. But then he sure had the women." Read more
